intro: Holarrhena ovata, commonly known as the Indian euphobia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa and parts of southern Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers followed by elongated, woody pods containing kidney-shaped seeds. It is valued for its medicinal properties, with its roots and bark used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. Holarrhena ovata is also an important species for soil stabilization and provides habitat for various wildlife.
